website_summaries.verdict: A solidly constructed controller that fits well in the hand, but the buttons may need a little breaking-in before they lose their stiffness.
pros: Compatible with Windows XP, 7, 8, and 10, as well as PS3 and Android 4.0 or above (so long as the device also supports OTG)
Works well with Steam and emulators
cons: Does not support Xbox or Mac OS
Some had problems with the shoulder buttons (L2, R2) not responding well

customer_reviews.title: Great product, super fast delivery, works perfectly with Windows 10. and older.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. Very easily figured it out, plug and go. I am a life-long Asteroids player and this is why i purchased this, I wanted to play it on my laptop. Great price, super fast delivery and I am quite satisfied with my purchase. I do want to say to potential buyers that this seller carries the controller that works with Windows 10 as well as being backward compatible. Many of the controllers to choose from don't work with Windows 10, so buyer beware. Buy this controller and enjoy your games.
customer_reviews.author: Tattoo Nana

customer_reviews.title: Controller for PC
customer_reviews.text: This a great controller for those who want play video game with out owning a Game system. The controller feels great. The vibration in the controller sync pretty with the game.
customer_reviews.author: K-Mak

customer_reviews.title: Worked out of the box with my PC and the games i used it for
customer_reviews.text: I'm an older guy but got a gaming PC for my son (8yrs old). He mainly plays RoBlox or Minecraft but i don't like those games so i got FarCry5 but could not remember the darn keys on the keyboard to play the game... so i got this controller and now it's like playing PS3. The game recognize the controller and defaulted the controls. You can change the controller settings since when flying the helicopter to me the joystick was backwards and it was confusing. But i like it and it worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: bacalhau75

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this controller because it is the best seller. I've been using it for a week and I'm very disappointed with the quality. It feels very cheap, and some of the triggers requiere you to press really hard, which is not ideal when gaming. I was thinking, perhaps I should not expect much for just such an un expensive controller, but then I tried the logitech F310 which is only $20 and the quality as far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Intelligencia Dormida

customer_reviews.title: Worked for almost a week.
customer_reviews.text: More and more of these cheap Chinese products flood this site everyday. I never learn my lesson. I always think, "this time... maybe". No. This is another in a long line or defective cheap Chinese electronics that has failed in less than 30 days. In this case the, R2 button and Thumbsticks quit working after a week. Disconnect / Reconnect, no. Disconnect / Reboot / Reconnect, no. Disconnect / Reconnect different USB port, no. Try another computer, no. It just quit. Pass this up and buy from a trusted brand name.
customer_reviews.author: JBA

customer_reviews.title: DOES * NOT * WORK * WITH * MAC OS !! Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Let me repeat: DOES NOT WORK ON MAC OS as plug'n'play! Have a Mac? DO NOT BUY this - it will not work. It didn't work on my 2015 MBP or my 2016 MBP or my 2014 MBA. Sure there is probably some sort of shady USB driver or frankenmac tweak you could make - BUT WHY?! There are alternatives that DO work as plug'n'play. That said, the build quality was good and it felt good in my hands - very much like a Sony PS controller - I would have really liked it *IF* it had worked plug'n'play on my mac.
customer_reviews.author: M. Black

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I was wasting time trying to always get my PS3 DualShock to work with my PC in Windows 10. Over and over again my SCPToolkit driver software would fail. What's more, only around 20% of the games I needed the controller for even recognized it as anything. Enter the ZD-V+. I plugged this controller in, and Windows 10 instantly recognized the device! No setup, no installation, no nonsense; just pure plug-n-play! I went straight to Burnout Paradise: Remastered in Windows 10 and was instantly driving terrible, with my hazards on (which I accomplish by constantly pressing the brakes over and over again). This controller did everything I needed, and worked flawlessly! 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't vibrate and triggers feel like bumbers
customer_reviews.text: This copies the style of the Dual Shock controls for the Sony Playstation but doesn't quite match the feel. I'm currently using this on PC but getting no vibration functionality. On top of this the triggers feel more like bumpers and it's hard to gauge just how hard you need to press them in order to perform certain actions. Tried calibrations and I'm still unable to get the top left corner exact on the left stick, it's possible mine is just defective. Apart from this it's still able to play a few games that don't require too much precision.
customer_reviews.author: Tisagh Chase

customer_reviews.title: best of its price point
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for its price. I'm always on the hunt for "that slightly cheap controller that doesn't compromise" and this one is great. Sticks are a bit looser than PS4, d-pad a touch stiffer. Buttons and d-pad do not get stuck in the housing no matter how hard you press - after 3 months of pretty frequent use. Good all around controller with no flaws, aside from the R2 / L2 buttons feeling slightly cheap. Shoulders in general are probably the worst buttons of the bunch, but still plenty usable. That said, this might not be your preferred FPS controller - no reason to put away your 360/XB1 controllers for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bisciglia

customer_reviews.title: Good controller for PC gaming
customer_reviews.text: Used for gaming on PC. No issues with the controller itself, have to press down with a little force to get the buttons to respond. As others have mentioned the controller cord length itself is a little short if you are trying to say play this on your couch, but I find it perfect for a PC setup.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent controller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Raspberry Pi 2 to use with RetroPie Emulation Station. It works flawlessly. Now I cam be reminded how much I sucked at some of the games, like U.N. Squadron for SNES. The controller looks every bit as good as the pictures. The drivers make it be recognized as an XBox 360 controller. I didn't have to install any drivers on my Pi.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Best Third-Party Dualshock 3 on the market
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for months for the best third party PS3 controller since the brand name Dualshock 3 is incredibly high priced. I've gotten 3rd party controllers before but they always have large dead zones or have under or overly sensitive sticks. This one feels great in the hand and well packaged. By far the best 3rd party controller you'll find on the market. The only complaint is the L2 and R2 buttons are literal buttons, rather than the triggers most people are familiar with and therefore aren't pressure sensitive. But they work and that's what matters most. Beyond pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these, about a month apart. First one worked for a little over a month and now suddenly doesn't work at all despite never having been dropped/misused. The second one, I bought a few days ago, already is showing signs of failure. The L1/2 are ok but R 2 barely responds and R1 has died. It's ridiculous. These controllers are trash abs shouldn't even be sold anymore. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Estella Brown

customer_reviews.title: A definite must have controller.
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to save money AND have a quality controller that plays like a PS4 controller for your PC without all the setup then this is the one to have! I tried to get into the Steam controller in hopes of replacing my very old Logitech precision controller but no matter how much I played around with it, it was a plain discomfort to use and an even greater annoyance on my hands due to button placements and the dreaded back buttons on the controller grip (I tend to grip my controllers heavily during gameplay). This little beaut is simplicity and that's my go-to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael .S. McRae

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Controller for Steam - Note: Update Drivers!
customer_reviews.text: So, I have been using this controller for Steam for a couple months now, and it rocks. I had some initial problems out of the box. It had spotty coverage among games. Then I went to izdtech.com and downloaded the latest drivers and the conntroller worked on my PC, Mac, even my Steam link! I was really impressed as I doubted it would work with the Mac or Steam link. But after installing the drivers it is able to run on every one of my systems. The controller itself feels like an old PS2 style controller, which I am comfortable worth. Considering the price this controller is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: ThomasJB

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly and the Instruction Manual is no help
customer_reviews.text: Computer did "recognize" the Controller; however, This Device is NOT User Friendly and the "Instruction Manual" is really NOT a Manual. I was looking for a Hand Controller that was "Simple" because I was getting tired of using the W, S, A and D Keyboard Keys' to move My War Robot with My Left Hand while using the Mouse with My Right Hand to move the Torso and Fire the Weapons'. The Gamepad Instruction Manual does NOT cover That nor any "Instructions' " on how to use It.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Not usable for 1st person shooters
customer_reviews.text: The joysticks have a large dead zone in the center, and the area for fine aim is very narrow. So if you're trying to aim at an opponent, you end up overshooting and turning fast. There is no fine control. The light in the middle of the controller is very bright and pretty distracting if you're playing with the lights off. Also, the firmware in their website is all in chinese, so you can't really tell what you are installing when it prompts you. Other than that, the controller is of very good construction and looks good. No problems with any of the other buttons.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: No longer works on Windows 10 on Asus laptop
customer_reviews.text: No longer supported by Windows 10. I've used this controller for a few years and worked perfect as plug and play. I had to disassemble the unit oncce because of a loose/broken solder which turned the controller off, but I was able to fix it and continue to use it. Now windows 10 on Asus gaming laptop won't recognize it. It prompts me to "reconnect the last USB I plugged in and if it's not recognized, the device maybe malfunctioning." I just recently updated my laptop and I'm thinking that may have something to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In the three hours or so I spent trying to ...
customer_reviews.text: In the three hours or so I spent trying to make this work, I did experience the nearly inexplicable problem others have mentioned - when I pull the trigger button it doesn't pull the trigger unless I really reef on it - but that was the least of the problems. The primary issue is that it's a generic controller that cannot be programmed to basic essential gaming controls. The left joystick (I'm a south paw) wasn't programable at all. Neither joystick compression function registered in setup. I currently have 5 different FPS and in none of them was I able to get this set up to do the basics - move around and shoot - never mind more complex actions.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Fiocchi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, short USB cord, but half decent
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a controller for my PC as my old xbox 360 controller is getting really worn out. It's decent but sometimes the shoulder buttons aren't responsive. Feels cheap. My biggest complaint is that at a little over 4 ft. long the cord is too short. If your PC tower isn't adjacent to where you sit the cord is going to be suspended in the air while you play, which is annoying as pets or other sentients can knock it out easily. Overall it can't compare to my busted xbox 360 controller.
customer_reviews.author: Odorous One

customer_reviews.title: Works well without configuration on PC, but triggers aren't analog.
customer_reviews.text: It's gets the job done. All the typical buttons of a PlayStation or Xbox controller, in PlayStation layout. The left and right trigger buttons (which are typically known as RT/LT on Xbox and R2/L2 on PlayStation) are NOT analog. I don't recall seeing that noted in the product description, but I likely missed that. Their action is also a bit off and many presses are missed, especially in the right trigger. That may simply be specific to my device. Who knows. Beyond that, it works well in my Windows 10 computer without any configuration (using it for Madden 19).
customer_reviews.author: Phil Rezanow

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great controller for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great controller for the price! Its controls are pretty smooth and the buttons press down evenly and never get stuck. The analog sticks are smooth and responsive. The only complain I have is that it will randomly stop working. I use it for Skyrim, Rocket League ETC, and probably have 20 hrs on this controller now. It has stopped working maybe 3-4 times and all you have to do is unplug it and plug it back in. A slight annoyance sure, but for $20 what more can you ask for? This was to replace my Steam controller which I did NOT care for as i hated the right "touch pad" and MUCH prefer the analog stick.
customer_reviews.author: J-Fresh

customer_reviews.title: Flop of a purchase...
customer_reviews.text: This was a total let down. Feels good and all front buttons and analog sticks work well. The fatal flaw with this gamepad involves the trigger buttons. First off they aren’t pressure sensitive at all. Secondly, and the absolute deal breaker about this product, is that you have to smash the L2/R2 triggers to the floor to make them activate at all. Because of this they don’t even activate like 75% of the time. I was really wanting something better than the run of the mill Logitech, but I switched back to the f310 and chucked this thing in the trash in less than 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Kosal

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason..but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The resistance of the joystick and buttons are good, and it is comfortable. Cons: This gamepad is cheap for a reason. The left joystick thumb-pad tore off after only 2-3 days of use. Also, it would not sync up with FIFA 18 properly, and I had to use some custom program / drivers to sync with FIFA 18 - even then it was not perfect and would mistake the 4-way direction pad for my joystick, so my 180deg motion was cut down to only 8 directions, which made passing the ball very difficult. Also, this is a foreign made product and has no support that I can find in English.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS is the budget controller you want
customer_reviews.text: I am just starting to ease over from a PS4 to PC for gaming and wanted to start off as cheap as possible and just went for the cheapest ds3 style controllers I could find... BAD IDEA. They were all horrible, then I saw this one for just a few dollars more and tons of great reviews. It works perfectly! You plug it in and it is good to go, no spending hours trying to get drivers installed like other budget controllers. The buttons are all tight and react perfectly, and it feels like a quality controller. Really, I would take this over the $59 controllers any day,.
customer_reviews.author: Hic Svnt Dracones

customer_reviews.title: cheap and pushing them were slightly difficult in the beginning but after breaking them in they're good to go
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. The only issue I have is are the buttons. They feel.cheap and pushing them were slightly difficult in the beginning but after breaking them in they're good to go. I don't recommend using these for call of duty. Any other type of game should be fine
customer_reviews.author: tone26

customer_reviews.title: Defective R2 and L2 buttons
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this product. I was initially very satisfied with the controller and sought to replace it with a new one when the old was accidentally damaged after serving me for a long time. Unfortunately, the unit I received appears to have defective R2 and L2 triggers. Both trigger buttons regularly fail to recognize inputs when reasonable force is applied to them and thus rendering the controller almost unusable. I am very disappointed in the quality of this unit given how well the first unit I purchased had performed.
customer_reviews.author: L.B.

customer_reviews.title: It does its job.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 3 stars only because the button click sound is a bit annoying for me and I have to be a bit stiff during my combos other than that this controller works perfectly well. Unless you are a gamer you will not notice the subtle inconveniences that I pointed out. If you are looking for a replacement controller for your system or console then this will be great. The only other drawback is that the cord is not very long I had to buy an extension so that I can play from my living room sofa. That is not a complaint more than it is an observation this product fulfilled my needs and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Don't look for stress-proof precision control
customer_reviews.text: Pros: now that I don't have to use arrow keys, I can suffer with a controller. It works, if you're not playing platformer or fighting game. cons: pressing the D-pad in any single direction if you also press very hard, it will also register a second unwanted direction. If I try to jump straight up after jumping diagonally, it's just too hard. I bought this mainly for Celeste, and Celeste is unplayable with it. Sticks are too big and clumsy even for my big hands. Just go for a classic gamecube controller and an adapter.
customer_reviews.author: A. O. OTALA

customer_reviews.title: Well, that didn't last long...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the controller all of a dozen times, and it seems the left control stick has begun to malfunction. I originally bought the item back in April, but only just recently opened it to use it. It seemed to work great at first, but now it seems to always track hard right (as in the character always runs to the right of the screen, even when the controller isn't being touched), thus making the controller effectively unusable. It looks great, but since it failed so soon, I'd say it definitely wasn't worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: works as expected, compatible with steam games, super easy to switch from mouse to controller
customer_reviews.text: with one click my computer registered the controller and with one click of my mouse i was back to mouse and keyboard. seamless and easy integration. i purchased a cord extender, however the cord is quite long and i do not need it. it's not a heavy controller but that's usually just extra junk companies add to make you think something is sturdier than it is. it's probably one of the reasons this is more affordable. overall good price for the quality
customer_reviews.author: J.Lynn

customer_reviews.title: this thing is excellent for gaming on a pc
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to play fortnight and it works great for the that game on my pc it was easy to install just plug and play. Quality seems ok no different than the ones you get with a Ps3 the cord length is good too there's plenty of cord to use if your sitting in front of your pc.
customer_reviews.author: Streetglide

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Do not respond to pressing button sometimes 1+2 on both sides
customer_reviews.author: yahya

customer_reviews.title: Does game things.
customer_reviews.text: Yup, plug and play, worked well, vibrated my *** off, feels good in hand. Makes laptop gaming much more palatable. Still prefer proper mouse and keyboard but thats neither here nor there. Which means it isn't anywhere so why did I bring it up? Anyway, I digress. But thats okay because I have said what needs to be said. It is adequate and in no way lacking. Redundant... just buy it if you want a controller, it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Calaway

customer_reviews.title: Get the wireless version
customer_reviews.text: Great for laptop gaming. The cord is not long enough for a desktop unless your pc sits between you and the monitor. you need an extension to be comfortable. I have two of the wireless versions of these and they are great. The keymapping for these is also off compared to the wireless. For example what would be x for psx control is o on these. I purchased the wired thinking i would not have to map the controls and it would interchange perfectly with the wireless. which works great between the two wireless controls but these need remapped or their own profile
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Decent controller but I wish I paid a little more and gotten a better controller.
customer_reviews.text: Decent controller for the money. Everything but the left and right trigger are built really well. However, the left and right trigger you have to press very hard to get it to work. Much harder than the LB and RB buttons. When playing an FPS and you aim you will find yourself coming out of your aim quite often because you are not holding the button down hard enough. In almost all games today the left and right trigger buttons are extremely important to have them not built properly. I contacted the seller about this and they told me it was normal. It's decent but I wish I paid $20 more and gotten a better controller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works...mostly.
customer_reviews.text: The controller had the issue of rotating my 3rd person camera when I had not put in any input to it for several games. Other then that it works fine and the issue seems to have corrected itself somehow. However I do sometimes press the function button thinking I'm pressing the pause button. And while that is cool and all, I don't really have a use or need to do that sort of thing. And I am trying to press pause, not the function button so I can start recording. So that is somewhat annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Arther

customer_reviews.title: A solid controller for PC!
customer_reviews.text: This controller is the best 3rd-party controller I've ever used or owned. I really love the feel of this, and it's so easy to play JPRGs or fighting games with! The only downsides? The USB cable is a bit short, even plugging it into the front of my PC ,and it doesn't seem to work well with RWBY: Grimm Eclipse (not recognized properly or something, probably a game issue more than the controller). Everything else seems to play fine though. Works great with Hyperdimension Neptunia RB1, Naruto Shippuden UNSFB3, BlazBlue, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Devon V

customer_reviews.title: Game On!
customer_reviews.text: This controller does exactly what it's supposed to do. I bought it to use with my Steam games and it does just that. I haven't had any issues during game play like it locking up. That being said, I would call myself a casual gamer at best. So, with time, and more game play, that could change. Should that happen, Amazon will be the first to know. I did deduct a star because the cord is a little short in my opinion. Admittedly most corded controllers are a similar length. But, another 6 inches would have been nice, especially if it's hooked up to a decent size TV. All in all, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Good controller.
customer_reviews.text: PS4 style without the PS4 buttons on the right side of the controller. Works just fine with my PC though, it's simple enough to figure out what the buttons are. All of the buttons seem really responsive and I've been using it constantly with no issues except it disconnects sometimes from my PC when left idled too long, and you just hold the button in the very middle a few times to cycle it through the pink and red settings back to blue and it works for my games.
customer_reviews.author: Kaosu

customer_reviews.title: Solved a tough problem
customer_reviews.text: I needed a game controller that would work with Windows XP. Not easy to find these days, but, after downloading a driver from the manufacturer's web site, this controller installed and worked perfectly. I especially like the fact that the controller offers a choice of three input modes, X-input, D-input, and Android, although I have used only the first two modes. Having had the device for only a few days, I cannot comment on its durability, but it seems well-made enough for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Live Free

customer_reviews.title: Review Time!
customer_reviews.text: Well, what can I say! I purchased this controller in March 2017 and been using it until today. Yes, it lasted me for two years. Everything was supposedly working fine. Of course, there was an input problem with one of the direction buttons. Honestly wasn't sure if it was a controller or in-game issue. Sadly, as of today, the controller has malfunctioned thus stopped working. Nevertheless, I will be making my second purchase for this controller since it lasted through my many dungeons, trial and raid run.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, I was hoping since this was a corded gamepad, it would work better than the wireless I picked up. This was supposed to be 'plug and play' and it is not. Does not work with my Windows 10. Tried with a couple of different games and no dice. I'm sure it might work for others, but mine did not. I now have a logitech and it works right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Steven E. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with fortnite
customer_reviews.text: We got this to play fortnite. We got one, and it worked for about 1-2 games and then 1/2 the buttons stopped working. We returned that one and ordered another one and 1/2 the buttons didn't work again. We ended up going to Game Stop and got a controller that was $5 more but it worked right as we plugged it in. Looks like a nice controller, just didn't work for our PC with fortnite. I gave it 2 stars (instead of 1) because I don't know if would work with other games besides fortnte.
customer_reviews.author: amie lowery

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: When some of the buttons on my old F310 gamepad became unresponsive, I decided to take a chance and try something new with the ZD-V+. Surprisingly enough, despite being in the same price range it has turned out to be a significant upgrade. The ZD-V+ is more comfortable to hold, has better analog sticks, and better shoulder buttons. It's comparable in quality to controllers made by console manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Controller That Will Get The Job Done
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Works out of the box as advertised - plug and play - Buttons are responsive and no troubles using the controller Cons: - Uncomfortable grip when used for long periods of time - D pad is unreliable. Very easy to get a diagonal input instead of a directional input even though only pressing one arrow on the D pad. Overall: The controller works fine and is compatible with PC. It will work for casual gamers, but precision gamers should look elsewhere for a higher quality controller.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rooks

customer_reviews.title: Broken Buttons
customer_reviews.text: I was completely won over by this gamepad because it was affordable and didn't need batteries, until I tried to play Skyrim. Turns out that trigger buttons aren't registering consistently, so all the spells I try to cast that I have to hold-charge for, aren't able to charge because the gamepad thinks I'm randomly letting go of the buttons. This never happened on my old Steam controller (which does need batteries). If it wasn't for that one game breaking issue, I would have loved this product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Macias

customer_reviews.title: Could be better they should run a test to show latency or fix it
customer_reviews.text: Look for the price u pay it’s what u get ... I play console and pc of course PS4 the connection to pc through steam the latency is way less. This controller has lag so I play rb6 in conjunction with mouse keyboard just so I don’t lose my skill on PS4... yet when deploying gadgets those is a lag Could be better they should run a video or maybe I will post one showing the latency vs controller so let me know if you would like I will do it and this will help u tweak this issue
customer_reviews.author: JONATHAN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent controller for my PC
customer_reviews.text: Excellent controller for my PC. I especially enjoy it because i'm accustomed to a PS4 controller, this has the same feel in my hand. The one thing i had to take a star for was the "L3, R3" where you push the stick in to run or crouch in most games. You have to depress them extremely hard and they're a little difficult to hold down far enough as you can't feel it. Aside from that, I've had no problems out of it.
customer_reviews.author: XxNosferatu

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Playstation-Styled Controller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Controller for my PC to play fighting games like Tekken 7 and Street Fighter 4 where I'm more used to the D-pad Input of a PlayStation controller over the Xbox Controller's D-pad and joystick layout and I have to say I enjoy it a lot. It feels fluid, responsive and most importantly familiar. As an added bonus it feels like a quality-made controller and doesn't feel like a cheaply-made "Mad-Cat" Controller. Recommended to anyone who plays computer Games and don't have a PlayStation Style Controller to use.
customer_reviews.author: The Raven

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, works well, fits comfortably in hands
customer_reviews.text: I had to emergency buy this, and it was a good decision. I had an XBox controller for my computer and was playing Monster Hunter World on PC. The game is awful trying to play with mouse and keyboard so I use controller. Well I accidentally stepped on the controller and messed up a joystick. I didn't want to fork over the money for a new expensive controller so I decided to find a cheapo one. This is honestly better than the xbox controller. It's more comfortable, works just as well, and even better, way cheaper than an Xbox controller.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable Delay
customer_reviews.text: There is a noticeable delay when using the L2 and R2 buttons. Using this controller takes the fun out of certain games because you are sure to lose if you're playing against someone who has a controller with better precision. I give it 3 stars because it does work for platform games, but I would not recommend it for any other games.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly Flowers

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing controller with quality buttons and sticks. However, it cannot give you that buttery precision that a Dualshock would. The sticks on this seem to have a significant deadzone and a very steep linear curve. It was tough sometimes when playing MGS2 on PC. For the price this controller is fantastic and it works with Android (if the games/apps support controller input)! I got 2.
customer_reviews.author: Kimchi

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after one use
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after one use. Gave it a one star because the seller was very responsive and did try and help. But in the end nothing could be done, just didn't work. It felt great in the hand, was looking forward to using it. Although I didn't like the fact that it didn't have the throttle buttons for R2 and L2 like other game pads, didn't matter to me for the games I was going to be playing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Gaming Controller Gampad Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: ZD-V +USB Wired Gaming Controller Gamepad for PC works great with my PC golf game. I am still getting acquainted with its many features and still trying to work them smoothly. But, so far, the controller is great. It saved me from returning the golf game which was useless using my mouse and keyboard. I recommend the gamepad.
customer_reviews.author: Harold G. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Unfortuately I purchased 2 of these....neither works. One stopped plugging into the usb on the 2nd or 3rd use. The other the usb connection wire has to be lifted slightly up in order to keep the controller working. A slight move and off it goes. Worst purchases ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it bad... 40 hours of gameplay controller
customer_reviews.text: only good thing about it, was cheap that it. the controller sticks is very wonky doesn't want to work most of the time. this thing died on me after 50 hours of actual gameplay use, the last moment of it was when it keep disconnect and reconnect itself. then it finally don't want to connect to my Computer no more.
customer_reviews.author: Don L.

customer_reviews.title: Best budget controller for PC and PS3
customer_reviews.text: It's basically a more angular Dualshock 2 with better analog sticks, but it works with both DInput and Xinput, as well as being compatible with the PS3 which fit my needs perfectly. The only real flaws are the analog shoulder buttons (the deadzones on L2 and R2 are very uncomfortable, requiring too much force for a full press) and the poor board shielding. Occasionally, putting pressure on the controller or jostling it the wrong way can cause phantom Start/Select inputs, which I can only assume is because of a lack of padding between the board and controller shell. Still, it's the best controller on the market for its price point, and far more reliable than alternatives like Afterglow.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable controller and no installation needed.
customer_reviews.text: After using this for a week, functions just like a PS controller. I use windows 10 and it's plug n play so did not need to install any drivers and worked instantly. I am currently using this for steam games and have no trouble with the application reading the controller. The buttons are responsive and two analog sticks are comfortable to use. The controller fix comfortably in my hands and am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Not horrible
customer_reviews.text: It's a good gamepad and feels nice but the one thing that kills it is the triggers. Batman Arkham Knight is very uncomfortable to play with this thing because you have to hold the triggers in so hard. If you aren't pressing hard enough the entire time then it fails and your hand just gets tired. Just a bad experience. If you don't need the triggers very often then it's probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: mikeyhalla

customer_reviews.title: Great gamepad!
customer_reviews.text: Truly an excellent pad IMO. Bought it to play the PC fighting game "Melty Blood" after being fed up with the Dualshock 4, and after days of testing I can say it works like a charm. The dpad buttons are tight and responsive, the triggers are comfortably positioned, and I've had no issues with any of the right buttons despite inputting long combo attack strings for hours on end. Only time will tell how long it holds up for such play, but for now I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller. It's much better than the Xbox controllers that for some reasons get better reviews. Unfortunately my dog escaped from his crate and ate it while I was at work last week. I bought the wireless version of this as a replacement. I'm not quite as impressed by it due to the rumble only functioning on one side. This one however, has been reliable and did not lose functionality over time.
customer_reviews.author: Fr05tByt3

customer_reviews.title: Best $20 controller. Period.
customer_reviews.text: In my search for a "good cheap" controller, I tried a couple of Logitech's and ended up with this one due to price. Its very comfortable, very durable, and noticeably higher quality than others in the sub $50 range. I prefer the stick placement to offset. Really wish there was an identical version, but with bluetooth. Would happily pay double the price for same build but wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It's nice and functional
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and functional. Fits well in the hand. Only real problems are that the light on the front is way too bright for when you're playing at night (i taped over it) and the triggers are just buttons. They still seem to react based on how hard you press them but there isn't much of a physical range to them for the most part they're either pressed or not. Still solid
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels very similar to a real PS3 controller
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect and feels and functions very similar to a real PS controller. I had gone as cheap as possible twice before. On both of them the buttons and joystick felt stiff and they broke rather quickly. I decided to quite being a cheap bastard and only be a kinda cheap bastard and spend a whole whopping 20 bucks instead of 10 and get this one. It has a much smoother action and feels much more like a real PS controller. Well worth the 10 extra bucks. If you’re on the fence between cheap and cheaper get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Great Controller For The Price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent controller for the price. The buttons are solid and feel much like console based controllers. The analog sticks are tight enough and the D-Pad is the same as a PS controller. About the only thing I could nitpick on is that the controller casing feels to be of a slightly less quality plastic but much better than a cheap brand controller. No software needed. Works very well with Windows 10 and Raspberry Pi systems (RetroPie, Amibian and Combian 64). I visited the company's website and apparently they only make wired controllers so far. Would like to get a wireless version of this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have only tested on Android MXQ Pro media box with two different emulators snes and nes. Initially controller did not work but after holding the mode button down for several seconds it switches the controller to a different mode that was able to be recognized by the media box. Controller automatically had correct button assignments for both emulators. I have yet to try on Windows anything, will maybe update later but I only wanted this for Android (The media box uses Android 5.1 Lollipop).
customer_reviews.author: datmanty

customer_reviews.title: Overall great controller. Joystick issues
customer_reviews.text: As a PC gamer I use controllers for some games, mainly emulators. It has great compatibility and ease of use. I noticed only a couple of days after I had been using this controller that the left joystick sits slightly on the right making characters is games seemlesly always moving right or running right. I have cuecked software and uaed with other games as well, but it still behaves in the same manner. I am disappointed with that specific issue. I purchased this particular controller because of all the great reviews it had. The shoulder buttons are also a little tough to press, but the joystick, to me, is a far more anoyying problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kelton Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the Logitech USB controller.
customer_reviews.text: Running Windows 7. Couldn't get my PS4 or XBOX controllers to work even with the recommended software. This was plug and play. The controller case is smooth/glossy. The main buttons and joysticks are good. The only gripe is the R1R2 and L1L2 buttons don't have as much springiness as I would like. Sometimes they won't respond because it thinks the button is still down. I wanted something more responsive and smoother than my Logitech USB controller...also I prefer at playstation controller to the huge XBOX 360 style controller. The blue light in the middle is always on if its plugged in to the USB port. Might be a negative.
customer_reviews.author: D. Curran

customer_reviews.title: Good for basic games on pc..
customer_reviews.text: This works as expected. The d-pad could use some work,especially for games that use all directions of the d-pad(fighting games). This one is missing it since it just has 4 buttons for the d-pad. I liked the rumble feature in this,till a few days later it stopped...than i heard this small piece rattling around in the controller. The rumbling feature stopped after this point. The controller still works and all,i just miss that d-pad feature and the rumblin..
customer_reviews.author: DaZonGotti

customer_reviews.title: Controller Inputs Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The controller feels well-made and looks good. It works immediately upon plugging into a windows 10 machine, which is nice. However, the inputs randomly cut out for 0.5-2 seconds at a time every 30 seconds or less. This makes any game unplayable and so it's a really useless controller. This happens on steam both in regular and big picture mode across games. Another user ran into issues and found drivers for the controller on a completely Chinese site - these drivers were not provided with the controller. They didn't fix my issue however. I'm not sure how this controller is rated so highly and am suspicious of how genuine these other reviews are.
customer_reviews.author: Zzyzus Anabolis

customer_reviews.title: Great handles, bright light.
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller, it works great, does its controller job, and picks up on all my steam games that are controller friendly with no issues. My only complaint is that the blue light that comes on in the center when the controller is plugged in is SO BRIGHT, that it pierces me in the eyes as I'm hunched over in bed playing games in a dark room covered in potato chips. Thankfully, I've remedied that by placing a small sticker over it. It wasn't enough of an issue for me to dock a star though.
customer_reviews.author: obsidianlips

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after around 5 months
customer_reviews.text: The controller itself is ok, perfectly fine PC controller, the problem is the quality of the usb cord, after a while it kept disconnecting and then stopped working completely, the d pad is cool tho
customer_reviews.author: saul

customer_reviews.title: Very nice controller
customer_reviews.text: Looks as good as the picture and feels really good in my hand as I use it. I like that I can just plug it into my USB port and play. I don't have to download apps, or press different buttons in a order to sync it with my computer or buy tons of batteries or worry if it's losing charge. I don't mind the cord at all as it is more than long enough. Price is reasonable and product is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle N.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but kinda big and the cord is too long
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a good controller and worked well, but the controller itself is a little bigger than your average PS3 or PS4 controller, which (personally) made it uncomfortable for me to hold and play with. The cord that connects from the controller to the PC or laptop is VERY long so if you are planning to buy this to play a game on your PC (if it's not to far from you) or your laptop, don't because it will only get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: If you don't mind the cord, it's a a good controller. Well made, analog sticks are very tight no loose play. Simple plug and play, no additional downloading of Xinput or anything like that. just as good as a PlayStation controller the computer identifies as a Xbox controller. Works perfect so far after a month. All controls are still tight no loose buttons, seems like it'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Fazio

customer_reviews.title: Works for raspberry pi
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use on my ps1 emmulator on my raspberry pi. They work great. Pay attention to the setting that you use because there are different modes for different applications (sony, nintendo, pc, etc). They work great. I haven't had any issues with them since i've gotten them.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Works on emulators and rom hacks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim and immediately thought I wouldn’t need it as I thought it only worked for PC games and the games I play don’t require a controller. However, I do play Pokémon rom hacks on various emulators (Visualboy Advanced, Desmune, Citra) and it works perfectly on them! I can customize the buttons to my liking and since I’m used to using playstation controllers, the gaming controller feels just like one. Now I haven’t played any games that require it to vibrate but I’m really happy with it as it is!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Green

customer_reviews.title: and HATE the feel of an xbox controller
customer_reviews.text: I am a big playstation guy, and HATE the feel of an xbox controller, so I went with this as my PC controller as it is so similar and was listed as an "Amazon Pick." I wish I could give this a 5 star, as I love the controller, but the right stick was not functioning from the get go. I tried swapping right and left, and sure enough, it still did not work! I am so disappointed that this did not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Todd P.

customer_reviews.title: To resume works fine but it could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Works with Windows and Android, but not fully operation, on windows doesn't work the rumble, you need a special driver that doesn't came with the gamepad, with android works too but the rumble doesn't work and not all game funtions works with the gamepad (It can be a game problem, but I don't really know). To resume works fine but it could be improved. EDIT On Win10 and Xinput the rumble works without special driver on some games but not all.
customer_reviews.author: vannca

customer_reviews.title: Nice controller but slippery.
customer_reviews.text: The controller works out of the box with Windows 10 and my emulators and GTA games. No drivers needed. But the controller itself has very smooth surfaces, and it will slide out of your hands or off your legs easily. I might throw some grip tape on it. Other than that I like it, especially the plug and play aspect.
customer_reviews.author: gtech215

customer_reviews.title: R2 L2 buttons are horrible
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to hold, joysticks are outstanding, but the ball was dropped with L2 and R2. Yes, these are buttons and not triggers or bumpers. You have to focus on pushing as hard as you can for them to work. I would not recommend for any shooter or racing game because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn J.

customer_reviews.title: I consider the PS3 controller sensitivity to be the best in the world
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to gaming controllers, this one is top notch. I look for PS3 sensitivity in my game controllers. I consider the PS3 controller sensitivity to be the best in the world, better than PS4's. I can comfortably play FPS games on PC successfully, in both single and multiplayer. The shoulder buttons are pressure sensitive also which was unexpected. This is a great value for a budget controller and will by a couple more. Only downside is that the direction pad. When pressing left or right, it will press up by accident. It's a real hassle when playing games that rely on it, like fighting games.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bent USB
customer_reviews.text: The controller isn't amazing it does the job though After being in my backpack, a book or something fell on the end of the USB connector, the metal bent inward from being too weak. I was able to unbend the metal and plugged it in, it still works fine. The LB and RB buttons on this controller are a little unsatisfying, since they are buttons not triggers like most controllers have. Overall the controller isn't bad per say, but I would recommend a different one. I have a Xbox one controller with a USB adapter that is more comfortable and more satisfying and also is apparently more durable. I recommend checking that one out for a little bit more money.
customer_reviews.author: GetCanned

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent
customer_reviews.text: The idea of getting a Playstation controller to work with games by telling the games it is an Xbox one was brilliant. I much prefer the feel of this style controller, but historically games would look at my controller like I had somehow plugged in an egg to the USB. This reads like Xbox controllers to the games, rarely requiring any setup whatsoever. Was totally worth it, made platformers more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Night

customer_reviews.title: The controller is as described and works great but unfortunately for me it was a tad too ...
customer_reviews.text: The controller is as described and works great but unfortunately for me it was a tad too big for my hands to use for gaming. I have small hands so it's a little tricky hitting the buttons, it would be fine for those that have bigger hands that can use this controller. Overall great controller downside is if you have small hands I would look else where, but if not then I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Grace McT.

customer_reviews.title: I was searching for a decently priced USB windows controller ...
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a decently priced USB windows controller, I had purchased and returned several before settling in on this one. While the controller itself works with windows as described, there are some issues with the casing being too thin and some sensitivity issues with the contacts inside that make the controller confuse itself. In other words, if you squeeze too hard while playing a game for a long period of time, you will end up sending multiple commands and doing weird things in-game. Other than intended. Oh, also don't bother using the vibration option, it shakes the unit and causes the same thing to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve C.

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good controller for my pc
customer_reviews.text: I was looking everywhere for at least a decent controller for my pc. I got this one and have had it for almost a year with no issues. It feels good to hold, and the buttons dont stick at all. The bumper buttons and everything else work good. READ YOUR MANUAL it's very important.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan C.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This controller is good in a pinch, and if you only ever use the face buttons you might never notice or care, but the shoulder buttons are blocky and the housing is sharp. The D-Pad is also just too blocky and painful to be comfortable. Somebody really needed to take a sander to these parts.
customer_reviews.author: Nori

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and serviceable for casual gaming
customer_reviews.text: This controller is okay for the price point. Definitely not a PS3/4 controller or Xbox quality level here. The joysticks and triggers are slightly mushy and across a few games I've tried with it there is a laggy response, like perhaps the contacts on the triggers aren't being engaged to send commands to the computer. Totally useable but if you are a serious gamer, spending twice as much will get you quality your expecting to trounce the competition.
customer_reviews.author: AmpFit

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE.
customer_reviews.text: I never post reviews, but after HOURS of troubleshooting problems with this device I am fed up. The controller worked great... for a few months until it suddenly had an “internal malfunction” and stopped working. All of the support on the website directs you to download Microsoft xbox accessory programs- and this is NOT an Xbox accessory. It conveniently stopped working just as soon as they jacked up the price from $20 to $33. This controller is a complete sham. DO NOT BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for A driving/shooter game
customer_reviews.text: If you want to use the triggers or bumpers, look elsewhere. The triggers are just buttons, and all together the feedback is awful. They have a moment of compression that registers as the ‘hit’, but requires SIGNIFICANT force to press it in further for a game like say, GTAV, to pick up that you’re accelerating or shooting. To rephrase, just holding the trigger normally will do only “60 mph” in the game (where as crushing the button in, because it’s designed poorly, will allow the car to get to the 120+ It suppose to be at).
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and the joysticks are very smooth and feel good. It also works perfectly plug and play with windows 10, steam, and ps3. That's all the positive things about it. It feels cheaply made. Buttons and bumpers are loud and feel like they'll break after normal use. The right bottom bumper started sticking after 1 day of normal use. Returned it. Don't buy this and spend a little bit more to get something that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for steam games and windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for pc gaming in windows 10, just plug it in and play, no software needed at all! Used it for a couple months and I can’t find anything negative to say about this at all. Feels just like a PS4 controller and lots of steam games are automatically configured for it.
customer_reviews.author: Drachida

customer_reviews.title: It looks and feels high quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed by the apparent quality. It's very sleek looking, and durable for the price. The buttons and joy sticks seem durable, there is no problem with buttons sticking and they are easy to press. My only issue is I can seem to get it to work with my snes emulator, or even get it to work at all. My computer recognizes the device, but nothing seems to show when I test it, then again I'm a tab bit computer illiterate and it probably a problem I can solve after a little research.
customer_reviews.author: Acorn

customer_reviews.title: May be a one-case defect
customer_reviews.text: Everything is so good about this controller except this: my R2 (I'm using it for PS3) does it work well. Sometimes I press it and it doesn't work. In my case it's to shoot a shotgun in a game and it doesn't work a lot of times....(I press repeatedly and for it to almost work fine I have to press and release big time and press again hard). It's really annoying!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Android 006

customer_reviews.title: Good controller; terrible trigger buttons
customer_reviews.text: This is generally a very solid controller; good build quality and good feel on the buttons and sticks. The glaring exception is the trigger buttons, which are amazingly bad. It makes me think the designer/manufacturer doesn't actually understand what a gamepad trigger button is supposed to feel like. They're impossible to partially press with any accuracy; it's basically all-or-nothing. I've been able to somewhat get used to this in the game I use the controller for most (Rocket League) but if you're used to normal trigger buttons this will require, at best, a frustrating adjustment period.
customer_reviews.author: Decrypt3

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming controller!
customer_reviews.text: The controller is perfect for small scale pc games! Such as little nightmare its perfect for. But if you want a controller that works with games light Grand theft auto V best look elsewhere as this controller dont work well in games such as that! Over all fantastic controller!
customer_reviews.author: Alis-Tech

customer_reviews.title: Hard button but not terrible
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like the l2 r2 top rear buttons. Not spring loaded like Xbox or Ps4 and seemed like you needed a lot of pressure for full compression . For an acceleration and brake button it’s painful for fingers to constantly have to applied hard pressure for those. Only thing I disliked. Worked like it should otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a decent controller...but looks are deceiving.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking it would function much like a standard PS4 controller...boy was I dead wrong. For starters, this controller is deceptively bulkier than what the images imply. And hitting the trigger buttons was a crapshoot. More often than not it wouldn't register properly. The controller never really felt comfortable in hand. Had I known that, i would have opted for an X-box controller...which is also big yet was a better fit overall.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Rosa
